and by imprisonment not exceeding two years.
Sec. 3* And be it further enacted and declared. That if any person shall be
prosecuted under this act, for the writing or publishing any libel aforesaid, it
shall be lawful for the defendant, upon the trial of the cause, to give in evidence
in his defense, the truth of the matter contained in the publication charged as a
libel. And the jury who shall try the cause shall have a right to determine the law
and the fact, under the direction of the court, as in other cases.
Sec. 4. And be it further enacted. That this act shall continue and be in
force until the third day of March, on thousand eight hundred and one, and no
longer: provided. That the expiration of the act shall not prevent or defeat a
prosecution and punishment of any offense against the law during the time it shall
be in force.
